name: Aparthotel Playa Mar

reviews.title: Great for a family holiday
reviews.text: Stayed for 2 weeks in June on recommendation of relatives. Took our daughter who is 2yrs 6 months. The room was clean, functional,safe but basic. Tv had cbeebies and nickjr in English !! Small kitchen is ok to do snacks etc bit nothing more. Staff and reps were great with kids and ours loved every minute. Only problem was everything was geared for 3yrs and above. They did a toddlers club but it was only 3 days a week. Pool was good and lots of play areas etc. Bit of a scramble for sunbeds despite a supposed no reservation policy. Expect to set your alarm for half 7 to get near the pool. We self catered but tried the buffet one night and it was fine. The walk down to the main square is a good half an hour at least but is enjoyable. The best advice we had was to use the hotel towels for the pool for a refundable €5 each. Overall had a great time and would recommend to friends with young children and would definately return.

We have just come back from a week at the Playa Mar. What a wonderful time we had. Thomson have got it so right with this hotel. If you are after a relaxing holiday in the sun - look no further. Fancy an hour off from the kids - no problem. The kids clubs entertained the kids and allowed my husband and I to top up our tans without having to keep one eye open. With children of 9 and 5, the kids drop in den meant they could go together which was brilliant for us as it gave us the balance of family time and couple time. The walk to the beach was a little too much in the heat for little legs but fantastic when you got there. Taxi rides to the beach were about 5 euros each ways so not too bad.
reviews.title: Absolute dream

reviews.text: We spent a week at the Playa Mar, returned a couple of days ago. Would definately go again. Apartment was plenty big enough, loads of storage and really clean. We also got the top floor and pool view we requested when booking. Pool area really clean too, usual prob with people reserving sunbeds during the night , but there were still plenty to use even in the afternoon. The poolside bar really good value for money and nice food. Thompson childrens club was great, our 6 year old enjoyed it a lot and the kidszone in the evening. The only thing we found that the time of her club was difficult if you did want to go out of the hotel for the day. The entertainment also finished at 11pm so great to be able to get some sleep and kids to sleep. We were able to watch from our balcony. Did use the restaurant a few times, breakfast selection really good value. The area was lovely, just a couple of minutes to the pine walk along the sea front which although quite a walk had lovely views and little bits of beach. Also recommend the boat trip to formentor beach, had a great day there. We will return soon, hope to get better weather next time.
reviews.title: was even better than we hoped for

reviews.text: Just returned from fantastic two weeks at the playa mar. We have two boys aged Two and Four. All four of us had a wonderful stay. The kids were kept busy all day and in the evening. Normally they are up and about at 5.30am, but at the playamar they were so busy in the day time that they slept in until 8-9am. Great news for us.
reviews.title: Ali G has nothing on T

reviews.text: The swimming pools are fantastic for the smaller children as the shallow end of the pool is reasonably large and has a beach effect walk in slope so even our two year old could waddle out some way before being out of his depth. The towels left on sunbeds that are then not used are a little irratating as the smaller kids do need to be constantly supervised and it can be a bit tricky from the second row. A little more thought for fellow guests would be nice.

reviews.text: The following is not a big issue, but some points of slight disappointment which may be rectified before the season finishes which would truly make it into a superb experience.

As described in other reviews the resort is a wonderful place with the pine walk into town being a picturesque way to stroll by the bay. It is very bumpy, as our buckled buggy axle will confirm. However, you can also walk down the road from the hotel which is handy and quicker particularly with small children. The bars/restaurants and cafe's offer a wide variety of choice, and you could probably stay in the resort for a good 3 months eating in a different good restaurant each day. As with anywhere there are some expensive ones, but also some that provide phenomenal value. There are some excellent restaurants within a 10 - 15 minute walk with Little Italy (on the pine walk) and Coral being two of them - it is worth booking though as they are constantly busy.
reviews.title: Beautiful resort, brilliant value

reviews.text: The hotel itself is excellent. Everybody is friendly, everywhere is clean and it is fantastic for the children - whether it be in the kids club or in the pools. The only things that are slightly negative are;

reviews.text: 2: The beds for me were very uncomfortable, the mattresses seemed quite old and I did wake with a sore back most days - possibly age, but i did find it more comfortable on the less used sofa bed.
reviews.title: Beautiful Area. Great for Kids

reviews.text: 3: As with many Spanish properties the apartments are tiled,and when you have young children coming out of the bath there are a few slips and bumps, definitely need to take care.
reviews.title: pollensa not marbella

reviews.text: We loved this holiday very much. We have an infant 20 months and the pools were perfect for him. We did intend to use the creche but didn't really need it. We did 10 days all-inclusive and would recommend anyone staying here being at least half-board, if not all inclusive when booking. The food was very good quality and plenty of choice even though only one restaurant. The dining room was spotless and the staff were amazing, nothing was too much for them anywhere in the hotel. Pleased with room and layout, plenty of storage. Didn't use kitchenette other than making a coffee but everything you would need was there.
reviews.title: Great Holiday! With minimal downsides

reviews.text: We were there during term time so nearly everyone had infants so not sure i'd like it if it was filled with school / teen kids as it would become very load and boisterous. The entertainment in the evening was very poor. Actually It never felt like we were being entertained just someone on a stage talking or singing rubbish songs to the starring tweenies wanting to dance and see Thomson The Dog. Only think for adults was bingo!! the world stopped for bingo at 9.30pm, which was when we always went back to the room to get away from it. The entertainment really let the side down.
reviews.title: Loved it but self-catering not recommended!

reviews.text: Pine walk was lovely in the morning (running) and evening with the little beaches all along to paddle in and bars to while away the hours gazing at the sea.
reviews.title: Nice Holiday !

reviews.text: There is nothing directly near the hotel so be prepared to walk 20/25 minutes to a bars and restaurants.
reviews.title: Perfect hotel and resort for a lovely family holiday!

reviews.text: We had an outside room facing the road (block 3) which could be noisy during the day but quiet at night. Friends had poolside room and found the entertainment quite loud in the evening and not much privacy during the day to sit out.
reviews.title: Excellent holiday at Playa Mar!

reviews.text: We really enjoyed our stay here. The Staff were really friendly. The day/night entertainment was great for what it was. Our 4-year old still talks about the holiday. she loved it with plently for her to do. We were half baord and the food was really good, buffet style with lots to choose from. We ate out in P.Pollensa and found it really expensive, so would definately recommend taking the half board option. The Hotel was a 10 minute walking distance to the main shopping area, pubs, restaurants etc, but we really enjoyed this walk during the day and night. Would go back in a flash!
reviews.title: Thoroughly Enjoyed our Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lovely apartment, very clean with large bathroom (bath and shower), though the kitchenette was small with limited facilities. The apartment blocks are very well laid out and easy to access - not sure if I would have liked to be there when the Hotel was full though. The pool areas were large with plenty of sun beds (not that there was much sun) but the pools (both indoors and outdoors) were freezing. Even the Jaqcuzzi was stone cold. Steam room and sauna weren't working either.
reviews.title: would not cook in this apt

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Kids clubs were excellent - though limited spaces (which wasn't a problem for us, but would be during higher season) and all the reps/entertainers were on the all day. The evening entertainment was varied but generally good fun.
reviews.title: Beautiful setting

aka: Aparthotel Playa Mar Hotel Port De Pollenca
description: This luxurious complex in Puerto de Pollensa (Majorca) is surrounded by the natural beauty of Majorca’s Northern coast. The excellent facilities offer fun and sports activities for the most demanding families. Disconnect at Playa Mar and get ready for your best holiday ever!
